Abstract: The human microbiome plays a pivotal role in health and disease, offering a new frontier for biomedical data scientists. Advances in sequencing technologies, particularly 16S rRNA and whole-genome sequencing (WGS), have revolutionized our ability to analyze microbial communities at an unprecedented scale. This research explores the intersection of microbiome science and data science, focusing on the computational challenges and opportunities in analyzing complex microbiome datasets. We discuss the application of machine learning and statistical models to decipher the intricate relationships between microbial composition and disease states. By integrating multi-omics data, this study aims to enhance our understanding of the microbiome's role in disease pathogenesis, paving the way for personalized medicine and novel therapeutic strategies.
